TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClientViaBehavior extends System.Object implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior

Docs.summary: The ClientViaBehavior is used by clients to specify the URI for which the transport channel should be created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If such a behavior exists in the behavior collection on a client endpoint, the transport uses the URI that it provides, while all the other channel layers in the stack use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> provided at <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory> construction time. This <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> also becomes the WS-Addressing `To` header.
Use this behavior when the immediate network destination is not the intended processor of the message to enable multiple-hop conversations when the calling application does not necessarily know the ultimate destination or when the destination `Via` header is not an address.
You can also set this value using the [\<clientVia\>](../Topic/%3CclientVia%3E.md) element in a client application configuration file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri uri) cil managed

Docs.param: The URI for which the transport channel should be created.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: The binding parameters to be applied to the service endpoint.

Docs.param: The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime> for which the client behavior is to be applied.
Docs.summary: Sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime.Via%2A> to the URI for which the transport channel is created.

Docs.param: The service endpoint that exposes the contract.
The endpoint dispatcher to be modified.
Docs.summary: Implements a modification or extension of the service across an endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> because this operation should not be performed at the client end.

Docs.summary: Gets or set the URI for which the transport channel should be created.
Docs.value: The URI for which the transport channel should be created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can also set this value using the [\<clientVia\>](../Topic/%3CclientVia%3E.md) element in a client application configuration file.
